answerText: Matthew Arnold[10] This other literary critic defended "art for art's sake" in his modern Platonic dialogue "The Decay of Lying." His thoughts on the "suffering of the artist" are described in his letter to Lord Douglass, "De Profundis."
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 1 | 12 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question:  [10] This literary critic first used the term "Philistine" to describe those who lack culture in his book Culture and Anarchy. As a poet, he wrote "Dover Beach."
